body.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- the smart web apps of today have evolved considerably in ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"value":"how","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":" they use usage analytics.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"The problem:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- various headwinds (COVID, Inflation) have impacted the industry, raising the cost of labour, and increasing the cost of doing business.  Revenue-making opportunities have become harder to pursue due to reduced fee pools and increased regulatory compliance.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- dynamic market conditions, increased cyber, compliance surveillance and increased operational risks have all contributed to enhanced monitoring of business activity, especially within client facing services.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- as bank services have undergone digitisation transformation, client bases have broadened, the costs to service clients have risen, and client behaviours seem more dynamic than before. Desks have thus transitioned into data-driven decision-making processes for both long term strategies and day-to-day business activities.\n e.g. which product line to push, which client to service - requires a methodological, data-driven approach","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- To remain competitive, banks must focus beyond regulatory commitments and invest in extending and diversifying their digital platforms, absorbing the higher cost of change. Here product roadmap decisions must be substantiated with quantitative analysis, rather than by 'gut feel'.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"How smart web apps help:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- provide guidance in day-to-day business activities through calls to action ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- assess performance against long term strategies","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- feeding back analytics into the product roadmap, to prioritise work items.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"How do they achieve this?","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Instrumentation","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- smart web apps are finely instrumented to capture user interactions: each business workflow step, each client interaction is measured alongside the context (state) of interaction. Non-functional information, e.g. time on screen, message latency, device information and other performance statistics are also captured. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Each app component may offer users a broad range of possible actions and possible states. Smart web apps often use middleware to capture actions and state changes, this systematically 'bakes in' analytics and reduces developer effort. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Whilst payloads vary significantly between instrumented events, a consistent data schema between events helps to reduce data normalisation efforts and helps optimise large scale analytics.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Aggregation and Persistence ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"- instrumented events from all client channels are aggregated together and persisted; events are labelled by source: by web app, messaging system, API endpoint, email services and third parties (e.g. Bloomberg, ECNs)","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Persistence technologies depend on requirements; data set size, data structures, read\\write performance and internal compliance steer the technology chosen. Esparter smart apps have used traditional on-premise SQL databases such as Postgres and SQL Server, cloud databases and no-sql dbs such as MongoDB, each have inherent advantages suited to particular use cases.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Analytics Engine","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This is the 'smart' part. The purpose of the analytics engine to ultimately provide business and clients real-time and strategic decision-support through quantitative analysis of instrumented data.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The initial step is to tracking business performance through key KPIs. KPIs tend to take the form \"increase revenue by x%\", \"increase flow by y%\", or \"increase engagement x for product y by z%\".","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Next step we track positive and negative outcomes, e.g. client revenue, accepted trades, positive responses to sales, marketing and research. Outcomes are often scalar and can be negative, e.g. pnl from a specific trade.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Finally we create MIS metrics of how instrumented events (or combination of events) relate to each outcome. The payload fields of these events (e.g. time on-screen of a trade idea) are like correlation coefficients, and can be pre-defined or dynamically monitored via inspection.  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"The above allows the analytics engine to identify which events are contributing to specific outcomes. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Hypothesis testing","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Given trends between interactions and outcomes, one may hypothesise how changes to instrumented events may impact overall project KPIs, e.g. revenue. This helps business prioritise improving specific workflows in the product backlog.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Prior to full-scale adoption, smart web apps facilitate 'A-B' testing to prove a causal relationship and measure realised gain. Here two versions of a workflow operate in parallel for different user segments. The scope of these changes can be small e.g. what information appears in term sheets, or large, e.g. a new instrument discovery workflow.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Another approach we borrow from marketing, involves a series of time limited \"campaigns\" of experimental workflows, typically promoted to relevant user segments, and tracking effectiveness.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"As alternative workflow versions use different data labels, relative outcome comparisons between alternative workflows can readily be made.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Reporting","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"In our most recent project we fed metric and KPI reports into the llama2 large language model. This allows business to ask prose questions, e.g. \"which product types are generating the most revenue?\", \"which industry sectors is client x looking at?\", \"what was the most successful trade idea last month\". LLMs currently work best picking out information from existing reports, albeit with unexpected\\erroneous responses. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We also looked into LLM dynamically conducting analytics, either by feeding raw usage into the LLM or via creating analytics queries fed into the analytics engine. However inferences made were not sufficiently accurate in order to make business decisions.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"All reporting-based approaches, e.g PowerBI, however are not typically integrated into many business processes, so are typically under-utilised in making day-to-day decisions or longer term strategies.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Calls to action","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Smart Web Apps typically provide recommendations or suggestions","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

contentfulArticle.heading: How to actually use web analytics
contentfulArticle.text: Last month's trend of capturing client usage, smart analytics and converting these into product enhancements and business objectives
